signed: signature and title on red label on back: M. Abakanowicz / Montana del / Fuego / 142 x 205 cm / 1986 | white label sewn on back: Montana / Del Fuego / 142 x 205 cm
text: Magdalena Abakanowicz worked in a variety of media but she is best known for her largescale sculptures of headless human figures, and three-dimensional textiles made of coarse sisal—a fiber derived from ropes and seldom used in weaving. Montana del Fuego demonstrates Abakanowicz’s distinctive fusion of weaving and sculpture as a “flat” wall hanging unexpectedly erupts into voluminous folds and trailing fringe. Abakanowicz was born in Falenty, Poland in 1930. The enthusiastic reception of her art in the West had few parallels among her Soviet contemporaries.
title: Montana del Fuego
